creator: xe@mdconnect.net
text:
I am running Apache 2.0.40 on Windows 2000 5.00.2195 SP3.  

When I attempt to shut down the 
server via the Apache Monitor the shutdown does not complete.  The Services applet indicates 
"Apache 2 Stopping..."  Eventually Stop:0x00000076 PROCESS_HAS_LOCKED_PAGES occurs.  


With registry hacked to include 
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Session Manager\Memory 
Management\TrackLockedPages 1 the stop message becomes STOP:0x000000CB 
DRIVER_LEFT_LOCKED_PAGES_IN_PROCESS and points to afd.sys. (Ancillary Function Driver for 
WinSock)

My afd.sys is dated 7/22/2002 12:05 PM and is version 5.00.2195.4667

Here is 
an excerpt from my Apache error log:

[Fri Aug 23 10:29:12 2002] [notice] Parent: Created 
child process 1332
[Fri Aug 23 10:29:13 2002] [notice] Child 1332: Child process is 
running
[Fri Aug 23 10:29:13 2002] [notice] Child 1332: Acquired the start mutex.
[Fri Aug 
23 10:29:13 2002] [notice] Child 1332: Starting 250 worker threads.
[Fri Aug 23 10:29:42 
2002] [notice] Parent: Received shutdown signal -- Shutting down the server.
[Fri Aug 23 
10:29:42 2002] [notice] Child 1332: Exit event signaled. Child process is ending.
[Fri Aug 23 
10:29:43 2002] [notice] Child 1332: Released the start mutex
[Fri Aug 23 10:29:44 2002] 
[notice] Child 1332: Waiting for 250 worker threads to exit.
[Fri Aug 23 10:30:12 2002] 
[notice] Parent: Forcing termination of child process 268 
[Fri Aug 23 10:32:44 2002] 
[notice] Child 1332: Terminating 1878053456 threads that failed to exit.
[Fri Aug 23 
10:32:44 2002] [notice] Child 1332: All worker threads have exited.
[Fri Aug 23 10:32:44 
2002] [notice] Child 1332: Child process is exiting

The problem is intermittent but often.  
It usually occurs while I have my browser, Opera 6.04 Build 1135, open and viewing a page on 
localhost, though it has also occurred with IE 5.00.3502.1000 viewing a page on localhost.

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
Let me guess: you are running ZoneAlarm.

If not, feel free to reopen this report.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 11801 ***
